main event: A bright, white object resembling a shell explosion was observed by several aircraft near Tacoma, Washington on June 29, 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as being whiter than magnesium and appeared to have a sawtooth pattern.
The object exhibited a horizontal flash and disappeared instantaneously.
The object was observed from multiple aircraft at different altitudes and locations in the vicinity.
An explosion was reported in the Tacoma area around the time of the sighting.
The object was tracked on radar, with a maximum speed of 1,521 knots recorded.
